properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 8 at 3:31AM CST until February 8 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...WINTRY MIX POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHEAST...

A quick-moving storm system will slide through this morning. Rain
may mix with or briefly change over to snow across northeast
Central Alabama. Temperatures are a few degrees below freezing in
the northeast right now, so there is a potential that rain will
actually be freezing rain before switching to snow in the
northeast, thus the expansion of the winter weather advisory.
Accumulations of a quarter inch to an inch of snow are possible
in mainly the higher elevations in the northern half of Cherokee
County where minor impacts could occur. Accumulations of up to a
half of an inch of snow are possible in isolated portions of
Cleburne, Calhoun and Etowah Counties with little to no impacts.
Ice accumulations of less than 0.05" could occur in the advised
areas as well, and could cause some minor issues on the elevated
surfaces through the morning.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of
up to one half an inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze.

* WHERE...Etowah, Calhoun and Cleburne Counties.

* WHEN...From 5 AM to 11 AM CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CST THIS MORNING
